body: All tests pass, and master has been merged in for easy merge.

thx, when this is merged, I have about 20 tests that are written to support this works properly under a wide variety of conditions. I will submit the new version of the local stream builder and the tests that correspond with this as well.
Any reason why you are removing the impl for StreamsDatumCountable?
StreamDatumCountable cause a bug in the Local Runtime environment that causes the component to crash. STREAMS-124  That bug needs to get fixed before its usable.

I get this when I apply the patch

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:3.0:compile (default-compile) on project streams-provider-datasift: Compilation failure
[ERROR]/incubator-streams/streams-contrib/streams-provider-datasift/src/main/java/org/apache/streams/datasift/serializer/DatasiftTweetActivitySerializer.java:[96,20] method userBuildActor in class org.apache.streams.datasift.serializer.DatasiftTweetActivitySerializer cannot be applied to given types;
[ERROR] required: org.apache.streams.pojo.json.Actor,org.apache.streams.datasift.interaction.User
[ERROR] found: org.apache.streams.pojo.json.Actor,org.apache.streams.datasift.twitter.User
[ERROR] reason: actual argument org.apache.streams.datasift.twitter.User cannot be converted to org.apache.streams.datasift.interaction.User by method invocation conversion
```
I assumed someone else would close this.  but i'll officially close this request.
Auto merge ok.  Added back in the test, but it is passing now.
Added license headers.  The original pull request comments still show up though.  but they are there.
New merges should have resolved the previous build errors
Pull request updated with change from volatile to atomic.
If there are no more issues, I will merge this today.
any more comments?  I'm ready to merge this
Instead of placing the Facebook code in com.facebook, could you put it in a package that falls in line with how we handle other data sources? e.g.: org.apache.streams.facebook
done, pushed.  wound up touching a quite a few files
@robdouglas would you authorize github:steveblackmon on your repo?  getting a 403

Finally I got this updated guys! Could you please check it and then we could close this?
Thanks!

Made requested changes.

Also cleaned up ComponentUtils.  Added missing comments and one method.
Added shutdownNow() call back in. Accidental removal.
:+1:  Good catch.  I thought this was identified in the code review, but must have gotten missed in the update shuffle.

Update with max batch size in read current.  Also, as of the current structure of streams there will always only be one thread calling read current.  And if there isn't, all variables are either method scoped or a concurrent queue.

Don't rely on the current structure of a single runtime to base synchronization decisions.  If readCurrent is threadsafe without locking, that is fine, but the structure of the runtime shouldn't be a factor.
I don't see the changes.  Are they pushed?

The method is threadsafe.  If we intend to require thread safety the read current method, we need to enforce from the interface.  I do not know of a single run time that would call readCurrent() from multiple threads, but if we want that to be the case we need to change the interfaces.

:+1:  This looks good.  Although this code is getting messy.  I think we probably want to look to refactoring this code out and creating mapping objects that will allow user to implement how the index/type/id are set.  We can create a default one that works the same as it currently does, but allow users to override it with custom ones.

This causes a NullPointerException in streams-provider-morever.  Likely, the logic just needs to be updated there.

Can you take a look?
Looking now. It builds and runs the tests fine for me, do you have any more specific information on how you were able to get this NPE?

loadData(org.apache.streams.data.MoreoverJsonActivitySerializerTest)  Time elapsed: 0.873 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.apache.streams.data.util.MoreoverUtils.fixActivityId(MoreoverUtils.java:63)
    at org.apache.streams.data.util.MoreoverUtils.convert(MoreoverUtils.java:55)
    at org.apache.streams.data.MoreoverJsonActivitySerializer.deserialize(MoreoverJsonActivitySerializer.java:84)
    at org.apache.streams.data.MoreoverJsonActivitySerializer.deserialize(MoreoverJsonActivitySerializer.java:37)
    at org.apache.streams.data.MoreoverJsonActivitySerializerTest.loadData(MoreoverJsonActivitySerializerTest.java:59)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
If there is no way to use the regular instagram converter, then I don't have an issue with merge.  Anyone else?

I am 100% in favor of having serialization of documents originating with a source provider implemented in that providers module rather than in a multi-channel provider module, wherever the schemas and observed datums are exactly the same.  Where multi-channel providers like datasift, sysomos, moreover, etc... have dependencies on source providers like twitter, facebook, instagram, ideally those dependencies should be optional:true

The streams-provider-instagram serializer is templated against MediaFeedData and other classes in org.jinstagram.entity, which contain gson not jackson annotations, so I would not expect it to be perfectly compatible with the instagram json fragments supplied by datasift.  Willing to open a ticket to see if this can be done.

:+1:.

I accidentally started this review on an internal fork.  https://github.com/w2ogroup/incubator-streams/pull/52

@renato2099 
Can you fix you pull request so that it does not contain merge conflicts please.

Hi Ryan,

Steve Blackmon wrote to the list saying that I should clean the metadata using a mvn clean install -U
This solved the problem. I also wrote the list saying that this resolved the issue and closed the JIRA issue. However, I still have doubts why this pom has this entry but I wrote that to the list as well. Maybe you could help me improving my maven knowledge by shedding some light on this?
Thanks Ryan!

LGTM
But @steveblackmon  could you explain the reasoning behind the renaming of TwitterStreamConfigurator to TwitterConfigurator? Is it just to make it shorter? or to make it compatible with the rest of providers?
Thanks! If somebody could merge this would be great :)

Hi Robert,

This looks great, but wouldn't it be better if you put the 500 value used for configuring the S3 reader as a constant? And maybe adding a simple test for this feature? I mean reading from a directory or from a single object, or at least opening a JIRA issue for it.

@renato2099 The scope of the module expanded, but the Configurator had a too-specific name.  Now it's in line with the pattern elsewhere, one Configurator per module capable of returning each type of Configuration.  Although really all most of them do is convert from typesafe to jackson.
Cool! So could anybody merge this please?
Hey guys so what's the decision on this?
Are there any unit tests associated with these changes that need to be updated or created?
Comment there are not any unit tests created or modified in this pull request, please explain.
No tests where created or modified with this pull request, please explain.

@renato2099 With the way the reader works, there is a price for an object listing... (1 cent per 1,000), seeing as the stream is exhausting the entire directory instead of reading just a portion, the constant of 50 || 500 is inconsequential. bumping to 500 will limit the # of round trip calls however. 

Agree, that it should be a setting, but presumably, one does run the risk of having soo many settings that it is too difficult to use. :o)
So could anybody merge this please?

@smashew I see, this totally makes sense then. But then it the cost is 1cent per 1000, then wouldn't it be better to use 1000?
I do understand your point, having too many configurations make it more difficult, but I don't think that having to recompile the code for a specific use case makes it less difficult. IMHO we should use a default value like 500 and if the user wants to change it, then he should be able to do it using the config files.

It is per listing you get back... I think. It turns out to be the same $$$ either way

Sent from my iPhone

IMHO we should use a default value like 500 and if the user wants to change it, then he should be able to do it using the config files.

Yeah you are right, it turns out to be the same $$$ [1], and this reader doesn't have too many configuration parameters ;) [2] but this is just my 2c. 
I think the changes are cool besides that :+1: 

[1] http://aws.amazon.com/s3/pricing/
[2]https://github.com/apache/incubator-streams/blob/master/streams-contrib/streams-amazon-aws/streams-persist-s3/src/main/jsonschema/org/apache/streams/s3/S3ReaderConfiguration.json
Why aren't there exceptions that can be thrown during processing? Seems odd that there is no way to report or trap any exceptions (other than termination) during execution.
There are other catches in the tasks.  This is just a final failsafe.
